com.premiumminds.webapp.wicket.testing

Class ExtendedWicketTester

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.wicket.util.tester.BaseWicketTester
      • org.apache.wicket.util.tester.WicketTester
        • com.premiumminds.webapp.wicket.testing.ExtendedWicketTester

  • public class ExtendedWicketTester
extends org.apache.wicket.util.tester.WicketTester
    A helper class to ease unit testing of Wicket form components without the need for a servlet container. The class adds methods to start a component in a form, which have the same functionality as BaseWicketTester.startComponentInPage(Component) and variants.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ExtendedWicketTester.StartComponentInForm
      A page that is used as the automatically created page for startComponentInForm(Class, String) and the other variations.

    • Method Detail

      • startComponentInForm

        public final <C extends org.apache.wicket.Component> C startComponentInForm(Class<C> componentClass,
                                                                            String inputType)
        Process a component. A web page will be automatically created with the markup created in BaseWicketTester.createPageMarkup(String).

        Note: the instantiated component will have an auto-generated id. To reach any of its children use their relative path to the component itself. For example if the started component has a child a Link component with id "link" then after starting the component you can click it with: tester.clickLink("link")

        Type Parameters:
        C - the type of the component
        Parameters:
        componentClass - the class of the component to be tested
        inputType - the type of HTML input to be associated with the component to be tested
        Returns:
        The component processed
        See Also:
        BaseWicketTester.startComponentInPage(org.apache.wicket.Component)

      • startComponentInForm

        public final <C extends org.apache.wicket.Component> C startComponentInForm(Class<C> componentClass,
                                                                            String inputType,
                                                                            org.apache.wicket.markup.IMarkupFragment pageMarkup)
        Process a component. A web page will be automatically created with the pageMarkup provided. In case pageMarkup is null, the markup will be automatically created with createFormPageMarkup(String, String).

        Note: the instantiated component will have an auto-generated id. To reach any of its children use their relative path to the component itself. For example if the started component has a child a Link component with id "link" then after starting the component you can click it with: tester.clickLink("link")

        Type Parameters:
        C - the type of the component
        Parameters:
        componentClass - the class of the component to be tested
        inputType - the type of HTML input to be associated with the component to be tested
        pageMarkup - the markup for the Page that will be automatically created. May be null.
        Returns:
        The component processed

      • startComponentInForm

        public final <C extends org.apache.wicket.Component> C startComponentInForm(C component,
                                                                            String inputType)
        Process a component. A web page will be automatically created with markup created by the createFormPageMarkup(String, String).

        Note: the component id is set by the user. To reach any of its children use this id + their relative path to the component itself. For example if the started component has id compId and a Link child component component with id "link" then after starting the component you can click it with: tester.clickLink("compId:link")

        Type Parameters:
        C - the type of the component
        Parameters:
        component - the component to be tested
        inputType - the type of HTML input to be associated with the component to be tested
        Returns:
        The component processed
        See Also:
        BaseWicketTester.startComponentInPage(Class)

      • startComponentInForm

        public final <C extends org.apache.wicket.Component> C startComponentInForm(C component,
                                                                            String inputType,
                                                                            org.apache.wicket.markup.IMarkupFragment pageMarkup)
        Process a component. A web page will be automatically created with the pageMarkup provided. In case pageMarkup is null, the markup will be automatically created with createFormPageMarkup(String, String).

        Note: the component id is set by the user. To reach any of its children use this id + their relative path to the component itself. For example if the started component has id compId and a Link child component component with id "link" then after starting the component you can click it with: tester.clickLink("compId:link")

        Type Parameters:
        C - the type of the component
        Parameters:
        component - the component to be tested
        inputType - the type of HTML input to be associated with the component to be tested
        pageMarkup - the markup for the Page that will be automatically created. May be null.
        Returns:
        The component processed

      • createFormPageMarkup

        protected String createFormPageMarkup(String componentId,
                                      String inputType)
        Creates the markup that will be used for the automatically created Page that will be used to test a component with BaseWicketTester.startComponentInPage(Class, IMarkupFragment)
        Parameters:
        componentId - the id of the component to be tested
        inputType - the form input type ('text', 'checkbox', 'password', etc)
        Returns:
        the markup for the Page as String. Cannot be null.

      • createFormPage

        protected org.apache.wicket.Page createFormPage()
        Creates a Page to test a component with startComponentInForm(Component, String, IMarkupFragment)
        Returns:
        a Page which will contain a form as a single child with the component under test as a single input
